author: timbeiko
content: Cool! <@!273808422753796097> <@!574864862338088960> could one of you merge https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/3640/

author: sky.cactus
content: I agree with <@543900561460822016>'s sentiment here <@552133098075193354>.  Developing tooling that uses the receipt API will be significantly easier if all receipts have the field rather than only some receipts.

author: sky.cactus
content: Just need one of them to approve.  Should auto-merge after that.

author: sunce86.
content: To me, it seems like an inconsistency. I mean, do other clients include base_fee field for pre London blocks also (for example)?

author: sky.cactus
content: `baseFee` doesn't make sense for pre-london blocks.  `effectiveGasPrice` does.

author: sunce86.
content: Even so, tools need to rely on the london fork number for some of the changes and on the client version for some other changes... Isn't much easier to follow the simple rule: all changes for London become effective on London fork number? Just my 2 cents...

author: sky.cactus
content: Not all tools need to rely on things that are only available in London.

author: sky.cactus
content: One can imagine an analytics tool, for example, that needs effective gas price but does not need base fee.

author: holgerd77
content: Yeah, I would also go along with the pre-London inclusion line, as just some other 2 cents
